summary.long: Galatians is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: Paul, an apostle (not from men nor through man, but through Jesus Christ and God the Father who raised Him from the dead),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and all the brethren who are with me,
To the churches of Galatia:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Grace to you and peace from God the Father and our Lord Jesus Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who gave Himself for our sins, that He might deliver us from this present evil age, according to the will of our God and Father,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to whom be glory forever and ever. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I marvel that you are turning away so soon from Him who called you in the grace of Christ, to a different gospel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which is not another; but there are some who trouble you and want to pervert the gospel of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But even if we, or an angel from heaven, preach any other gospel to you than what we have preached to you, let him be accursed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As we have said before, so now I say again, if anyone preaches any other gospel to you than what you have received, let him be accursed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For do I now persuade men, or God? Or do I seek to please men? For if I still pleased men, I would not be a bondservant of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I make known to you, brethren, that the gospel which was preached by me is not according to man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I neither received it from man, nor was I taught it, but it came through the revelation of Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you have heard of my former conduct in Judaism, how I persecuted the church of God beyond measure and tried to destroy it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I advanced in Judaism beyond many of my contemporaries in my own nation, being more exceedingly zealous for the traditions of my fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when it pleased God, who separated me from my mother’s womb and called me through His grace,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to reveal His Son in me, that I might preach Him among the Gentiles, I did not immediately confer with flesh and blood,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: nor did I go up to Jerusalem to those who were apostles before me; but I went to Arabia, and returned again to Damascus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then after three years I went up to Jerusalem to see Peter, and remained with him fifteen days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I saw none of the other apostles except James, the Lord’s brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now concerning the things which I write to you, indeed, before God, I do not lie.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Afterward I went into the regions of Syria and Cilicia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I was unknown by face to the churches of Judea which were in Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they were hearing only, “He who formerly persecuted us now preaches the faith which he once tried to destroy.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they glorified God in me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then after fourteen years I went up again to Jerusalem with Barnabas, and also took Titus with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I went up by revelation, and communicated to them that gospel which I preach among the Gentiles, but privately to those who were of reputation, lest by any means I might run, or had run, in vain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet not even Titus who was with me, being a Greek, was compelled to be circumcised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this occurred because of false brethren secretly brought in (who came in by stealth to spy out our liberty which we have in Christ Jesus, that they might bring us into bondage),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to whom we did not yield submission even for an hour, that the truth of the gospel might continue with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But from those who seemed to be something—whatever they were, it makes no difference to me; God shows personal favoritism to no man—for those who seemed to be something added nothing to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But on the contrary, when they saw that the gospel for the uncircumcised had been committed to me, as the gospel for the circumcised was to Peter
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (for He who worked effectively in Peter for the apostleship to the circumcised also worked effectively in me toward the Gentiles),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and when James, Cephas, and John, who seemed to be pillars, perceived the grace that had been given to me, they gave me and Barnabas the right hand of fellowship, that we should go to the Gentiles and they to the circumcised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They desired only that we should remember the poor, the very thing which I also was eager to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Peter had come to Antioch, I withstood him to his face, because he was to be blamed;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for before certain men came from James, he would eat with the Gentiles; but when they came, he withdrew and separated himself, fearing those who were of the circumcision.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the rest of the Jews also played the hypocrite with him, so that even Barnabas was carried away with their hypocrisy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when I saw that they were not straightforward about the truth of the gospel, I said to Peter before them all, “If you, being a Jew, live in the manner of Gentiles and not as the Jews, why do you compel Gentiles to live as Jews?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We who are Jews by nature, and not sinners of the Gentiles,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: knowing that a man is not justified by the works of the law but by faith in Jesus Christ, even we have believed in Christ Jesus, that we might be justified by faith in Christ and not by the works of the law; for by the works of the law no flesh shall be justified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But if, while we seek to be justified by Christ, we ourselves also are found sinners, is Christ therefore a minister of sin? Certainly not!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if I build again those things which I destroyed, I make myself a transgressor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I through the law died to the law that I might live to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have been crucified with Christ; it is no longer I who live, but Christ lives in me; and the life which I now live in the flesh I live by faith in the Son of God, who loved me and gave Himself for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I do not set aside the grace of God; for if righteousness comes through the law, then Christ died in vain.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O foolish Galatians! Who has bewitched you that you should not obey the truth, before whose eyes Jesus Christ was clearly portrayed among you as crucified?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This only I want to learn from you: Did you receive the Spirit by the works of the law, or by the hearing of faith?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are you so foolish? Having begun in the Spirit, are you now being made perfect by the flesh?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have you suffered so many things in vain—if indeed it was in vain?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore He who supplies the Spirit to you and works miracles among you, does He do it by the works of the law, or by the hearing of faith?—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: just as Abraham “believed God, and it was accounted to him for righteousness.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore know that only those who are of faith are sons of Abraham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Scripture, foreseeing that God would justify the Gentiles by faith, preached the gospel to Abraham beforehand, saying, “In you all the nations shall be blessed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then those who are of faith are blessed with believing Abraham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as many as are of the works of the law are under the curse; for it is written, “Cursed is everyone who does not continue in all things which are written in the book of the law, to do them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But that no one is justified by the law in the sight of God is evident, for “the just shall live by faith.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet the law is not of faith, but “the man who does them shall live by them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Christ has redeemed us from the curse of the law, having become a curse for us (for it is written, “Cursed is everyone who hangs on a tree”),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that the blessing of Abraham might come upon the Gentiles in Christ Jesus, that we might receive the promise of the Spirit through faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Brethren, I speak in the manner of men: Though it is only a man’s covenant, yet if it is confirmed, no one annuls or adds to it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now to Abraham and his Seed were the promises made. He does not say, “And to seeds,” as of many, but as of one, “And to your Seed,” who is Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this I say, that the law, which was four hundred and thirty years later, cannot annul the covenant that was confirmed before by God in Christ, that it should make the promise of no effect.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if the inheritance is of the law, it is no longer of promise; but God gave it to Abraham by promise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What purpose then does the law serve? It was added because of transgressions, till the Seed should come to whom the promise was made; and it was appointed through angels by the hand of a mediator.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now a mediator does not mediate for one only, but God is one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is the law then against the promises of God? Certainly not! For if there had been a law given which could have given life, truly righteousness would have been by the law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Scripture has confined all under sin, that the promise by faith in Jesus Christ might be given to those who believe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But before faith came, we were kept under guard by the law, kept for the faith which would afterward be revealed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore the law was our tutor to bring us to Christ, that we might be justified by faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But after faith has come, we are no longer under a tutor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you are all sons of God through faith in Christ Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as many of you as were baptized into Christ have put on Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is neither Jew nor Greek, there is neither slave nor free, there is neither male nor female; for you are all one in Christ Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if you are Christ’s, then you are Abraham’s seed, and heirs according to the promise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now I say that the heir, as long as he is a child, does not differ at all from a slave, though he is master of all,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but is under guardians and stewards until the time appointed by the father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even so we, when we were children, were in bondage under the elements of the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the fullness of the time had come, God sent forth His Son, born of a woman, born under the law,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to redeem those who were under the law, that we might receive the adoption as sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And because you are sons, God has sent forth the Spirit of His Son into your hearts, crying out, “Abba, Father!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore you are no longer a slave but a son, and if a son, then an heir of God through Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But then, indeed, when you did not know God, you served those which by nature are not gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now after you have known God, or rather are known by God, how is it that you turn again to the weak and beggarly elements, to which you desire again to be in bondage?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You observe days and months and seasons and years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am afraid for you, lest I have labored for you in vain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Brethren, I urge you to become like me, for I became like you. You have not injured me at all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You know that because of physical infirmity I preached the gospel to you at the first.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And my trial which was in my flesh you did not despise or reject, but you received me as an angel of God, even as Christ Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What then was the blessing you enjoyed? For I bear you witness that, if possible, you would have plucked out your own eyes and given them to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have I therefore become your enemy because I tell you the truth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They zealously court you, but for no good; yes, they want to exclude you, that you may be zealous for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But it is good to be zealous in a good thing always, and not only when I am present with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My little children, for whom I labor in birth again until Christ is formed in you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I would like to be present with you now and to change my tone; for I have doubts about you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tell me, you who desire to be under the law, do you not hear the law?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is written that Abraham had two sons: the one by a bondwoman, the other by a freewoman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he who was of the bondwoman was born according to the flesh, and he of the freewoman through promise,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which things are symbolic. For these are the two covenants: the one from Mount Sinai which gives birth to bondage, which is Hagar—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for this Hagar is Mount Sinai in Arabia, and corresponds to Jerusalem which now is, and is in bondage with her children—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but the Jerusalem above is free, which is the mother of us all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For it is written:
“Rejoice, O barren,
You who do not bear!
Break forth and shout,
You who are not in labor!
For the desolate has many more children
Than she who has a husband.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now we, brethren, as Isaac was, are children of promise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But, as he who was born according to the flesh then persecuted him who was born according to the Spirit, even so it is now.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless what does the Scripture say? “Cast out the bondwoman and her son, for the son of the bondwoman shall not be heir with the son of the freewoman.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then, brethren, we are not children of the bondwoman but of the free.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Stand fast therefore in the liberty by which Christ has made us free, and do not be entangled again with a yoke of bondage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed I, Paul, say to you that if you become circumcised, Christ will profit you nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I testify again to every man who becomes circumcised that he is a debtor to keep the whole law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have become estranged from Christ, you who attempt to be justified by law; you have fallen from grace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we through the Spirit eagerly wait for the hope of righteousness by faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in Christ Jesus neither circumcision nor uncircumcision avails anything, but faith working through love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You ran well. Who hindered you from obeying the truth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This persuasion does not come from Him who calls you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A little leaven leavens the whole lump.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have confidence in you, in the Lord, that you will have no other mind; but he who troubles you shall bear his judgment, whoever he is.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I, brethren, if I still preach circumcision, why do I still suffer persecution? Then the offense of the cross has ceased.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I could wish that those who trouble you would even cut themselves off!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you, brethren, have been called to liberty; only do not use liberty as an opportunity for the flesh, but through love serve one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For all the law is fulfilled in one word, even in this: “You shall love your neighbor as yourself.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you bite and devour one another, beware lest you be consumed by one another!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I say then: Walk in the Spirit, and you shall not fulfill the lust of the flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the flesh lusts against the Spirit, and the Spirit against the flesh; and these are contrary to one another, so that you do not do the things that you wish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you are led by the Spirit, you are not under the law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the works of the flesh are evident, which are: adultery, fornication, uncleanness, lewdness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: idolatry, sorcery, hatred, contentions, jealousies, outbursts of wrath, selfish ambitions, dissensions, heresies,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: envy, murders, drunkenness, revelries, and the like; of which I tell you beforehand, just as I also told you in time past, that those who practice such things will not inherit the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, longsuffering, kindness, goodness, faithfulness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: gentleness, self-control. Against such there is no law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those who are Christ’s have crucified the flesh with its passions and desires.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If we live in the Spirit, let us also walk in the Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let us not become conceited, provoking one another, envying one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Brethren, if a man is overtaken in any trespass, you who are spiritual restore such a one in a spirit of gentleness, considering yourself lest you also be tempted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bear one another’s burdens, and so fulfill the law of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if anyone thinks himself to be something, when he is nothing, he deceives himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But let each one examine his own work, and then he will have rejoicing in himself alone, and not in another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For each one shall bear his own load.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let him who is taught the word share in all good things with him who teaches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not be deceived, God is not mocked; for whatever a man sows, that he will also reap.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he who sows to his flesh will of the flesh reap corruption, but he who sows to the Spirit will of the Spirit reap everlasting life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And let us not grow weary while doing good, for in due season we shall reap if we do not lose heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, as we have opportunity, let us do good to all, especially to those who are of the household of faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See with what large letters I have written to you with my own hand!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As many as desire to make a good showing in the flesh, these would compel you to be circumcised, only that they may not suffer persecution for the cross of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For not even those who are circumcised keep the law, but they desire to have you circumcised that they may boast in your flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God forbid that I should boast except in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ, by whom the world has been crucified to me, and I to the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in Christ Jesus neither circumcision nor uncircumcision avails anything, but a new creation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as many as walk according to this rule, peace and mercy be upon them, and upon the Israel of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From now on let no one trouble me, for I bear in my body the marks of the Lord Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Brethren, the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator
